item.title: New Tips for Inclusive Recruitment and Hiring at the Library
item.dc:creator: Gail Persily
item.description:
During the past year, one of the objectives the Diversity and Inclusion Work Group tackled was to implement clear and standardized hiring practices that incorporate best practices in recruiting diverse talent. Our efforts included reviewing our current practices, researching best practices and writing up a set of actionable best practices ...

Read moreNew Tips for Inclusive Recruitment and Hiring at the Library

item.title: How to Nominate someone for a STAR Achievement Award
item.dc:creator: Gail Persily
item.description:
As a follow-up to Chris’s post Nominate a STAR for a $5,000 Award, here are some details about the nomination process. Also, remember that you can continue to nominate folks for STAR Spot awards through June 2018. STAR Achievement Award Nominations are due by Noon, March 29! Criteria Nomination should ...

Read moreHow to Nominate someone for a STAR Achievement Award

item.title: Kaori Takes New Role at UCSF
item.dc:creator: Gail Persily
item.description:
Kaori Keller, from the Learning Tech team, has taken a new job at UCSF School of Nursing, which starts January 2! She will be the instructional designer on a team that is launching a new online Doctor of Nursing Practice (DNP). The DNP initiative has been in the making for ...

Read moreKaori Takes New Role at UCSF

item.title: The Library Diversity and Inclusion Report is Available!
item.dc:creator: Gail Persily
item.description:
Thank you to all who participated in activities during Kawanna Bright’s visit to gather information and help us assess the Library’s diversity and inclusion environment. Based on the information she gathered via the staff focus groups and climate survey, Kawanna was able to put together a report with recommendations to ...

Read moreThe Library Diversity and Inclusion Report is Available!

item.title: Hello Zoom, Bye Bye WebEx
item.dc:creator: Gail Persily
item.description:
I am happy to announce that UCSF has adopted Zoom as a campuswide platform for web/video conferencing. You should have received an email from the campus IT Service Desk announcing the rollout on October 4. Many of you have already been trying it out. As of October all staff can ...

Read moreHello Zoom, Bye Bye WebEx

item.title: Please Participate in the Diversity and Inclusion Climate Survey
item.dc:creator: Gail Persily
item.description:
You should all have received an email from Kawanna Bright last week on Aug. 30, asking you to complete the Diversity & Inclusion climate assessment she prepared for us. ICYMI, here is her email and link to the survey. Thanks to everyone who already responded! Dear Members of the UCSF ...

item.title: Diversity & Inclusion at UCSF Library – Recording of Kawanna Bright’s wrap-up
item.dc:creator: Gail Persily
item.description: Hi. For those of you who were not able to attend Kawanna Bright’s presentation today, here is a recording of her presentation. She provided some preliminary observations from her meetings and discussions over the past two days.

item.title: Teddy Gomes Presents on Open Access Policy Project Friday July 7
item.dc:creator: Gail Persily
item.description: As part of the monthly Library Updates series, Teddy Gomes will be presenting about her work to improve UCSF faculty participation in the open access policy. Friday, July 7, 9:00 am, Room 201 Attend remotely: https://ucsf.zoom.us/j/150580339

item.title: STAR Recognition Awards 2016-17
item.dc:creator: Gail Persily
item.description:
The Library Leadership Team is very pleased to share the results of this year’s STAR Achievement and Spot award nominations. Thank you to everyone who participated in the process. The STAR Achievement Awards were decided by a large committee which included 2 staff members from every department under the EVCP unit. ...

item.title: Campus STAR Spot Awards
item.dc:creator: Gail Persily
item.description:
Now that we’ve nominated our colleagues for STAR Achievement Award this year, we wanted to get the word out about the Spot Awards offered through the campus STAR Awards program. Please consider nominating a staff member (see eligibility list) for a $1,000 STAR Spot Award. What is a STAR Spot ...
